text:
Alden is a city in Rice County, Kansas, United States. In 2010 census, 148 people lived there.
History.
Alden was created in 1872. It was a station on the Atchison, Topeka and Santa Fe Railway. Alden was named after Alden Speare, a railroad employee. The first post office in Alden was established in 1882.
Geography.
Alden is at (38.244093, -98.311492). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 148 people, 61 households, and 47 families living in Alden.
